alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 10:38PM CDT until June 17 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, and minor flooding along some of the creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1034 PM CDT, radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain repeatedly developing and tracking over eastern and southeastern Kimble County. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches has already occurred, and additional rainfall up to 1 inch is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Kimble County - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 385 crossing Falls Prong and James River crossing Little Devils River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
